problem_text:
a) If A, B, C are torsion-free abelian groups with A ∼= A ⊕ B ⊕ C, must A ∼= A ⊕ B?
b) What if, furthermore, B ∼= C?
G. M. Bergman
answer: No, not necessarily, even in case b). See (A. L. S. Corner, in Proc. Colloq. Abelian Groups (Tihany, 1963), Budapest, 1964, 43–48); I also have an example with B and C of rank 1 as torsion-free abelian groups. (G. M. Bergman, Letter of 20 February 2011.)
